org.jcvi.jillion.sam

Interface SamWriter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable

    public interface SamWriter
extends Closeable
    SamWriter is an interface for writing SAM or BAM encoded files.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

    • Method Detail

      • writeRecord

        void writeRecord(SamRecord record)
          throws IOException
        Write the given record to the SAM or BAM file. Different implementations of SamWriter might delay actually writing out the SamRecord either to improve disk writing performance or to re-sort records.
        Parameters:
        record - the SamRecord to write; can not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem writing the SamRecord
        NullPointerException - if record is null.

      • newSortedBamWriter

        static SamWriter newSortedBamWriter(File outputBam,
                                    SamHeader header)
                             throws IOException
        Create a new SamWriter that will write out a sorted BAM file and corresponding index. The index file will be named "$outputFile#getName.bam.bai" will also be created in the same directory as the outputFile.
        API Note:
        This is a convenience method that is the same as: 
         new SamFileWriterBuilder(outputBam, header)
                   .reSortBy(SortOrder.COORDINATE)
                    //create index with extra metadata
                   .createBamIndex(true, true)                             
                   .build();
        Parameters:
        outputBam - the output file to write to; can not be null. The file extension must be ".bam".
        header - the SamHeader; can not be null. The sort order specified in the header is ignored and overridden to be SortOrder.COORDINATE to be a valid sorted BAM file.
        Returns:
        a new SamWriter that will write a sorted BAM file with a corresponding index file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem creating the writer.
        Since:
        5.3
        See Also:
        SamFileWriterBuilder

      • writeBamIndexFor

        static File writeBamIndexFor(File sortedBamFile)
                      throws IOException
        Write a new Bam index file ( .bai file) for the given input BAM that will write a Bam index file to the same directory as the input bam and name it sortedBamFile.getName() +".bai".
        API Note:
        this is the same as 
          
 new BamIndexFileWriterBuilder(sortedBamFile)
                    .includeMetaData(true) //includes metadata that Picard and samtools use
                    .assumeSorted(true)
                    .build()
        Parameters:
        sortedBamFile - the sorted input BAM file to parse and create an index from; can not be null, must exist and end with ".bam".
        Throws:
        IOException - if there are any problems creating any missing output files or if the input BAM file does not exist.
        NullPointerException - if inputBamFile is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the file extensions aren't correct.
        Since:
        5.3
        See Also:
        BamIndexFileWriterBuilder
